1:
Sing songs to praise God, who enables us to be strong when we fight our enemies;\q1 shout joyfully to God, whom we descendants of Jacob worship!
\q1
2:
Start playing the music, and beat the tambourines;\q2 play nice music on the harps and lyres.
\q1
3:
Blow the trumpets during the festival to celebrate each new moon,\q2 each time the moon is full, and during our other festivals.


\q1
4:
Do that because that is a decree for us Israelite people;\q2 it is a command that God made for the descendants of Jacob.
\q2
5:
He made it a law under at the time when God led the descendants of Joseph out of the land of Egypt. \q1 I heard a voice I did not recognize, and it said:


\q1
6:
"After the rulers of Egypt forced you Israelites to work as slaves,\q1 I took those heavy burdens off your backs,
\q2 and I enabled you to lay down those heavy baskets of bricks that you were carrying.
\q1
7:
When you were greatly distressed, you called out to me, and I rescued you;\q2 I answered you out of a thundercloud.
\q2 Later I tested whether you would trust me to give you water when you were in the desert at Meribah.



\q1
8:
You who are my people, listen while I warn you!\q1 I wish that you Israelite people would pay attention to what I say to you!
\q1
9:
You must not have any idols of other gods among you;\q2 you must never bow to worship any of them!
\q1
10:
I am Yahweh, your God;\q2 It was not any of those gods who brought you out of Egypt;
\q1 I am the one who did it!
\q2 So request what you want me to do for you, and I will do it.



\q1
11:
But my people would not listen to me;\q2 they would not obey me.
\q1
12:
So because they were very stubborn,\q2 I allowed them to do whatever they wanted to do.



\q1
13:
I wish that my people would listen to me,\q1 that the Israelite people would behave as I want them to do.
\q1
14:
If they did that, I would quickly defeat their enemies;\q2 I would strike dead those who are oppressing them.


\q1
15:
Then all those who hate me would cringe before me,\q2 and then I would punish them forever.
\q1
16: But I would give you Israelites very good wheat,\q2 and I would fill your stomachs with wild honey."
